Classes.Generating Statistics:
Generating Statistics

The Fate Die Method

  1. The Fate Die: The Magic Keeper rolls 1d4 in secret and keeps the result hidden.
  2. Observe Fate Together: Gather 5d4s and distribute them as evenly as possible amongst the squadron. All players roll their d4s.
  3. The Choice: Starting with the player who had the most recent birthday (then clockwise), that player must choose to either "Deny Fate" or "Accept Fate."
    4. - Deny Fate: The Magic Keeper reveals and removes the Fate Die with no effect. Remove the lowest d4 from the pool and reduce the highest die by 1. Add up the remaining 4d4s — this is one character Statistic. - Accept Fate: The Magic Keeper reveals the Fate Die. The number revealed is Blocked by Fate. All d4s matching that number must be rerolled. If the new roll matches again, the die is reduced by 1. If "1" is Blocked and a 1 is rolled again, remove the die from the pool. Add up the d4s — this is one character Statistic.
  4. Fate's Surprise: If players chose "Accept Fate" but NO dice were Blocked by Fate, then ALL dice change to match the number revealed by the Fate Die.
  5. Totaling Your Dice: If the total is lower than 6, it becomes 6. If above 16, it becomes 16.
  6. Continue to Observe: If you do not have six numbers, return to Step 1. If you have 6 numbers, proceed.

Herald's Constellation (Alternative)

If the squadron decides not to use the Fate Die method, they may instead use the Herald's Array:

15 / 14 / 13 / 12 / 11 / 8

Each player may choose to reduce one Statistic by 2 and add those 2 points to another Statistic. This may not raise the chosen Statistic higher than 14 or reduce it lower than 6. This may be done twice.

Classes.Herald Rules:
Herald Rules

The Herald is an Outsider ally who grants Magi-Knight powers through Soul Crystals.

Four Rules of a Herald

RuleDescription
Non-InterferenceCannot directly assist in battles. May only: allow transformation, imbue Runes, trade for Shards
EruditionKnowledge must be earned through research, not freely given. Provides baseline only
BalanceArrives when lives are at stake. A life saved = a life potentially lost later
SilenceExistence of Magi-Knights must remain secret. Erases memories of those who discover the truth

Herald Statistics

StatValue
HP200
Armor24
ResistanceMagic
Recovery25 HP/Sleep (only if MKs don't need healing)

Attacking the Herald

DO NOT RECOMMEND
  • Damage dealt to Herald also applies to ALL Magi-Knights
  • Attacker takes 3 Crystalline Fractures (can kill)
  • Attacker loses 25 SP with Herald (can go negative)
  • If Outsider attacks: ½ damage reflected as True Damage, damage split among MKs

    • Herald Departure

  • If Herald leaves Cardinal Realm >24 hours: All connected MKs die
  • If Herald dies: All connected MKs die within 24 hours

Classes.Soul Oblation:
Soul Oblation

Once Per Player, Once Per Saga. Used as a Free Action.

Soul Oblation (Rep I+)

  • HP and MP are fully restored, repair 3 Crystalline Fractures
  • During first turn in a round: gain one additional Move Action, Standard Action, and Bonus Action
  • Gain 10 Temp HP per Magi-Knight Level
  • Ignore any penalties from Stress and Exhaustion Levels
  • Any Attack Rolls, Rolls to Resist, or Skill Checks lower than 10 become 10
  • Immune to all Conditions (except Unconscious) and ignore Trauma Point gains
  • All Leadership Skill Checks become a Natural 20
  • All squadmates receive an Inspiration Point

    • Greater Soul Oblation (Rep II+)

    Additional effects:
  • All Statistics become 24 (+7) for the duration of the Soul Oblation

    • Ultimate Soul Oblation (Rep III+)

    Additional effects:
  • Each Round your first Attack Roll, Roll to Resist, and Skill Check becomes a Natural 20

    • Soul Oblation Consequences

  • At 0 HP you must activate Heroic Conviction even if it would cause 8 Crystalline Fractures
  • If the Magi-Knight turns on allies, the Herald returns the power inward, killing the Magi-Knight
  • Soul Crystal explodes (8 Crystalline Fractures) 60 seconds after combat ends or after 5 minutes of battle, killing the Magi-Knight. Cannot be prevented unless an ability specifically references Soul Oblation

Classes.Magi-Squires:
Magi-Squires

Magi-Squires are NPC companions assigned to Magi-Knight Mentors by the Herald.

Squire Assignment

  • Assigned to a PC (Mentor) upon introduction
  • For all purposes, Squires are considered Magi-Knights unless rules specify otherwise
  • Mentors can gain Social Points with Squires as NPCs
  • Upon assignment, Squire gains 1 Inspiration Point

    • Squire Statistics

    ResourceValueNotes
    Health Blips6No Crystalline Fractures (estimated in HP)
    Mana Blips3Does not increase with level
    Student Armor13—
    Magi-Knight Armor15Melee Style: +2 Armor
    ProficiencySame as equivalent MK level—

    Squire Damage and Healing

  • Any damage = lose 1 Health Blip
  • Lethal Damage (10 + 2× Squire Level) = lose 2 Blips
  • 0 Blips = Unconscious
  • Multi-target healing = restore 1 Blip
  • Single-target healing or Shard = restore 2 Blips
  • Damage while Unconscious = death

    • Squire Stress and Exhaustion

  • Maximum 3 Exhaustion, 3 Stress
  • Points directly reduce related checks (no Endurance Die)
  • Exhaustion reduces Weapon Damage
  • Stress reduces Spell Damage

    • Squire Spell Paths

  • Choose 1 Spell Path at introduction, gain 2nd at Level 4
  • Access only: Beam, Explosion, Curing, Restoration
  • Spell Attack: 2 + Proficiency Bonus
  • Max Tier per level as normal MK (max Tier V, 1/Sleep Phase)
  • Lower tier spells cost same as higher (1 Mana Blip)

    • Fighting Styles

    StyleArmorRangeDamage
    Melee+2 MK ArmorMelee1d6+3 (2d6 at L5, 3d6 at L10, 4d6 at L15)
    RangedStandard60 ft1d6+3 (2d6 at L5, 3d6 at L10, 4d6 at L15)

    Initiative and Actions

  • Takes turn directly after Mentor's turn
  • Does not roll Initiative
  • Battle Awareness (10th Level): At start of each round, considered Overseeing the Battle

    • Paired Attack (Special Action)

    Type: Immediate Action Effect: Squire prepares to follow up Mentor's Attack
  • Mentor's next Weapon Attack gains Advantage
  • Damage dice rolled twice, take highest
  • Target must be in range of both Mentor and Squire
  • Squire forfeits their next turn

    • Squire Skills

  • Proficiency in 2 Skills (Mentor's choice)
  • Grant +2 (instead of +1) when Assisting Skill Checks

    • Squire Leveling

  • Levels up when Mentor levels up
  • New-Rice Squires start at Level 1 and gain level per 4 Training Tallies (instead of 8)
  • New-Rice Magi-Knights cannot mentor New-Rice Squires

    • Other Squire Rules

  • Cannot gain Gloom Gems or hold Shards of Power
  • Participate in Combination Maneuvers as MK
  • Restore Unity Points to maximum during Sleep Phase
  • Gain Inspiration normally
  • Mentor may use Squire's Inspiration (with Keeper approval and appropriate roleplay)
  • Squires need Inspiration to participate in Combination Maneuvers
  • Mentors may roleplay giving their Inspiration to Squires

    • Squire Bonds

  • Count as Magi-Knight for Bond Level purposes
  • Bond Level matches points invested by other MK

    • Squires During Phases

  • School Phase: Do not roll for classes (Keeper narrates as NPC)
  • Free Time: Considered NPCs, do not gain Free Time benefits
  • Sleep Phase: Return to full HP/MP Blips, -2 Exhaustion, -2 Stress (unless Feverish Dreams)

    • Death of a Squire

  • Squadron must Roll to Resist (Purity; 3 Trauma; DC 16/12 to Resist 2)
  • Shard of Fate created at Encounter end (given to MK with most SP)
  • If squadron would be below 5 members, new Squire recruited next day
  • Shard of the Magi-Knight NOT generated for Squires
